data.title: up on: Queen Hortense
data.meta_description: Queen Hortense, Duchess of Saint Leu, was the daughter of Joséphine de Beauharnais, the wife of King Louis of Holland, and mother of Napoleon III.
data.text:
Introduction

Queen Hortense, Duchess of Saint Leu, was the daughter of Joséphine de Beauharnais, the wife of King Louis of Holland, and mother of Napoleon III.

Documents

– Download and play Hortense’s most famous composition, Partant pour la Syrie

Biographies

– BEAUHARNAIS, Hortense de, (1783-1837), Queen of Holland

Images

Bibliography

– The Memoirs of Queen Hortense, notes by Jean Hanoteau, 2 vols, London: Thornton Butterworth, 1928

– Makers of History, Hortense, by John S. C. Abbot, New Haven and London; Harper & Bros, 1870

– Memoirs of Hortense de Beauharnais, Duchesse of St. Leu, ex-Queen of Holland, by Auguste de Messence, Comte de Lagarde, Philadelphia: Key and Biddle, 1833

– Queen Hortense, by Luise Mühlbach, translated from the German by Chapman Coleman, New York: D. Appelton and Co., 1890 – available as an e-book (external link)

– Daughter To Napoleon : A Biography of Hortense, Queen Of Holland, by Constance Wright, New York: Holt, Rinehart And Winston, 1961
